title: Paulo Dybala gives damning verdict on 'not nice' Man Utd transfer talk
text:

Paulo Dybala has offered a damning verdict on summer interest from Manchester United - by insisting he never wanted to join the club.

Dybala was tipped to head to the Premier League with the Red Devils and Tottenham linked with late moves to try and acquire his signature.

But the Argentinian stayed put at Juventus amid reports he turned down a move - and he has worked his way back into favour.

He scored the opener in their Derby D'Italia win over Inter Milan at the weekend before opening up on his difficult summer.

The 25-year-old claims it wasn't a "nice thing" being linked with clubs where he "didn't want to go" before the transfer window shut.

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

"It wasn't an easy summer," the 25-year-old told Tuttosport.

"Hearing your name linked to every team and every place, where you don't want to go, isn't a nice thing.

"But this is football, even if before the transfer window opened I said: 'I want to stay here.'

"I had already done an interview in which I said I wanted to stay in Turin, then I never spoke again: not even in the America's Cup and on holidays.

(Image: Getty Images)

"I think it was more important to let the pitch do the talking, even if until the last day no-one knew what would happen. I wanted to stay, I wanted to play here and continue my career at Juve.

"I think I can still give a lot and I showed a glimpse of that against Inter.

"That's exactly what I wanted. Both me and Higuain - that's what we want.

(Image: REUTERS)

"I believe that the two of us spoke little of everything that happened, but we wanted to stay at Juventus and ... well, look - we both have scored goals at Inter. It's better to talk on the pitch with facts."

After failing to land Dybala in January, both Manchester United and Tottenham have struggled.

United in particular have lacked goals and creativity that the playmaker could have offered, failing to replace Alexis Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku, both on the losing side as Dybala downed Inter Milan at the weekend.
description: Paulo Dybala has given his verdict on his summer as he stayed at Juventus after Man Utd and Tottenham transfer interest
